refusal.translation[0].definitions[0].de: when you say firmly that you will not do, give, or accept something
refusal.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: His request was met with a blunt refusal.
His refusal to pay the fine got him into even more trouble.
They couldn’t understand her refusal of a scholarship to Yale.
refusal.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: Her stubborn refusal to admit the truth was trying his patience.
She had not anticipated a flat refusal.
This point-blank refusal to discuss the issue enraged him.
A blunt refusal to help will simply damage relations further.
My request was met with a polite refusal.
refusal.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to let someone be the first to decide whether they want to buy something you are selling before you offer it to other people
refusal.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: If you ever sell the business I’d like to be offered first refusal.
